content: If you enable this user, they will be able to log in to {{productName}} again and access their documents and data.

comment.text: This translation key describes the text displayed when enabling a user's access to {{productName}}, allowing them to log in and access their documents and data. It appears in a dialog for changing user status.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "إذا قمت بتفعيل" is a bit verbose and not the most natural way to say 'If you enable'. A more concise and common translation would be "عند تفعيلك" or "بتفعيلك".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: عند تفعيلك هذا المستخدم سيتمكن مجدداً من تسجيل الدخول إلى {{productName}} والوصول إلى مستنداته وبياناته.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "If you enable this user" is slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "Əgər bu istifadəçini aktiv etsəniz..."
The variable {{productName}} is correctly placed, maintaining consistency with the English content.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed. Variable placement is correct.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb 'ədə edəcəklər' (will obtain) is a little formal and less common in everyday language. A more natural verb would be 'alacaqlar' (will have).
The verb form 'θα μποεί' is incorrect. It should be 'θα μπορεί'.
The word 'συνδεεί' is misspelled. It should be 'συνδεθεί'.
The Armenian translation uses a comma (,) after 'մուտք գործել {{productName}}'. In Armenian, a period (.) is typically used to end a sentence or clause.  Using a comma creates an unnatural pause.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Եթե ​​միացնեք այս օգտվողին, նա կկարողանա նորից մուտք գործել {{productName}}․ իր փաստաթղթերն ու տվյալները:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'accedere nuovamente a' is a bit clunky. A more natural translation of 'log in to' would be 'riaccedere a'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Se abiliti questo utente, potrà riaccedere a {{productName}} e accedere ai propri documenti e dati.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation uses "{{productName}}" just like the English, but it's generally preferred to localize variable placeholders. Consider a Lao equivalent or just the localized product name.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "{{productName}}" with the localized Lao product name or a Lao placeholder like "{{ຊື່ຜະລິດຕະພັນ}}".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The pronoun 'hij/zij' is overly formal and clunky for this context. It's a literal translation of 'he/she' and doesn't flow naturally in Dutch. A more natural phrasing would avoid this construction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Als u deze gebruiker inschakelt, kan hij/zij weer inloggen bij {{productName}} en toegang krijgen tot hun documenten en gegevens.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Using 'inloggen' instead of 'aanmelden' feels more natural and aligns better with the English 'log in'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Als u deze gebruiker inschakelt, kan hij/zij weer inloggen bij {{productName}} en toegang krijgen tot hun documenten en gegevens.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Using the singular possessive 'hun' (their) instead of 'zijn/haar' is generally preferred for inclusivity and a more modern tone. While 'zijn/haar' isn't grammatically incorrect, 'hun' is more commonly used in contemporary Dutch.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Als u deze gebruiker inschakelt, kan hij/zij weer inloggen bij {{productName}} en toegang krijgen tot hun documenten en gegevens.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'log in to {{productName}}' is translated as 'conecta din nou la spațiu {{productName}}'. While 'conecta' means 'connect', 'spațiu' (space) isn't the most natural translation for the platform name. A more accurate translation would be 'se va putea conecta la {{productName}}'.

The word "подключите" (podkluchite) which translates to 'connect' or 'plug in' doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'enable' in the context of user status. It implies physically connecting something, not granting permissions.
The use of 'ඔහුට/ඇයට' is a bit clunky. While grammatically correct, it's less fluent in modern Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be more appropriate.
The word 'සබල' is accurate for 'enable' but can feel a bit formal in this context. Depending on the target audience, a more casual term might improve readability.
The pronoun 'он/она' (he/she) is clunky and impersonal. It's better to rephrase to avoid this direct pronoun or use a more neutral formulation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ако омогућите овог корисника, корисник ће моћи поново да се пријави на {{productName}} и приступи својим документима и подацима.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The pronoun 'on/ona' is awkward and unclear. It should be clarified based on the user's gender. If the gender is unknown, a gender-neutral alternative is preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ako omogućite ovog korisnika, on će moći/ona će moći/on može/ona može ponovo da se prijavi na {{productName}} i pristupi svojim dokumentima i podacima.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing "Якщо ви ввімкнете цього користувача" is slightly awkward. A more natural Ukrainian phrasing would be "Якщо ви активуєте цього користувача" or "Якщо ви дозволите цьому користувачеві".
